transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Namaste, bhaiya, this is Vikram from SBI Customer Support. Aapka account emergency mein hai!

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: Namaste, Vikram ji. Kya hua? Mera account toh theek hai.

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Arre, bhaiya, aapke account se fraudulent transaction ho raha hai. ₹50,000 ka transfer detect hua hai.

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: Kya? Maine toh koi transfer nahi kiya. Yeh kaise ho sakta hai?

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Sir, yeh cyber fraud hai. Aapko turant verify karna hoga warna pura balance chala jayega.

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: Achha, toh kya karna hoga? Main abhi bank jaaun?

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Nahi nahi, bank jaane ki zarurat nahi. Bas yeh link kholiye, http://secure.sbi-verify.com, aur apna OTP daal dijiye.

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: OTP? Yeh toh dangerous lag raha hai. Main bank call karke confirm kar leta hoon.

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Bhaiya, time waste mat kijiye! Yeh fraudsters aapka account khali kar denge. Abhi link kholiye!

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: Nahi, Vikram ji, main pehle bank se baat karunga. Aapka number do, main callback karunga.

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Sir, yeh urgent hai. Call mat kijiye, bas link pe click kijiye warna hum responsible nahi honge!

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: Nahi, main risk nahi le sakta. Main bank jaa raha hoon. Thank you.

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Namaste, this is Neha from BlueDart Courier. Sir, I’m calling about a package in your name stuck at Mumbai hub.

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: Namaste, Neha ji. I didn’t order anything recently. What package is this?

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Sir, it’s a special Diwali gift delivery marked urgent. You need to clear a customs fee of ₹2500 on http://bluedart-securepay.com.

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: Diwali gift? From whom? I’m not expecting any surprises.

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: The sender details are confidential, sir. But if you don’t pay by today, the package will be returned tomorrow.

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: That sounds suspicious. Can you tell me what’s inside the package?

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: It’s a high-value item, sir, possibly electronics. Please visit the link I gave to confirm and pay.

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: I’m not clicking on any link without proper details. Can I get a tracking ID or something?

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Of course, sir. It’s BD-987654. But time is running out, you must act fast!

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: I’ll check with BlueDart directly. What’s your contact number for follow-up?

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Sir, no need for that. Just call 1800-555-1234 if you have doubts, but pay online now to avoid losing the gift.

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: I’m not comfortable with this. I’ll verify with BlueDart’s official number. Thank you.

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Sir, you’re risking a valuable Diwali surprise! Please reconsider!

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: I’ll take that risk. Goodbye, Neha ji.

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Hello, sir, this is Priya from SBI Customer Support. Your SBI YONO subscription is about to expire. Please renew immediately at http://sbi-secure-renew.in for just ₹499 to avoid account suspension.

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: Hello, Priya. I didn’t know there’s a subscription for YONO. I’ve been using it for free.

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Sir, this is a new mandatory update from SBI for security. If you don’t renew by today, your account access will be blocked.

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: That sounds odd. I’ll check with my bank branch directly.

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Sir, there’s no time for that. This is urgent! Diwali is coming, and you won’t be able to make transactions if your account is blocked.

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: I’m not comfortable with this link. Can you send an official email or something?

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Sir, we don’t send emails for such urgent matters. Just click the link or call our helpline at 1800-555-7890 to confirm your details.

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: I’m not sharing anything over the phone. I’ll verify this with SBI’s official number.

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Sir, please don’t delay. If your account gets suspended, it’ll take weeks to reactivate. Think about your family’s needs during Diwali!

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: I appreciate the concern, but I’m not falling for this. I’m hanging up now.

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Wait, sir! This is not a scam, I’m just trying to help!

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: Sorry, but I don’t trust this. Goodbye.

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Namaste, madam. This is Priya from SBI customer care. There’s a suspicious transaction on your account.

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: Namaste, Priya. Suspicious transaction? I didn’t get any SMS or alert.

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Madam, it’s an unauthorized withdrawal of Rs. 25,000. We need to secure your account immediately.

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: 25,000? That’s shocking! But why no message from the bank?

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: The system is updating, madam. Please visit http://secure.sbi-verify.com to block the transaction.

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: Hmm, I usually get alerts. This link looks strange. Can’t I go to the branch?

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Madam, the branch will take days, and Diwali is coming. You might lose more money. Act now!

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: I’m not sure. Can you send an official email or something?

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Email takes time, madam. Just share your account number and OTP to stop this fraud.

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: OTP? No way! I know banks don’t ask for that. Is this a scam?

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: No, madam! I’m trying to save your money. Please trust me!

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: I’m calling SBI directly to confirm. I don’t trust this.

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Madam, don’t delay! Your money is at risk!

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: I’m hanging up. I’ll report this call.

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Wait, madam, you’ll regret this!

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: Goodbye.

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Hello, madam, this is Priya from SBI Customer Care. How are you today?

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: Hello, I’m fine, thank you. What is this about?

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Madam, there’s a serious issue with your account. A fraudulent transaction of ₹50,000 was attempted just now.

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: What? I didn’t make any such transaction!

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Don’t worry, madam, but we need to secure your account immediately. Please visit http://secure.sbi-verify.com to verify your details.

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: Wait, I’ve never heard of such a website. Is this official?

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Yes, madam, it’s our secure portal. If you don’t act now, your account could be blocked by tonight.

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: This sounds suspicious. Can I call the bank directly?

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Madam, there’s no time! Diwali is coming, fraudsters are active. Please trust me, just click the link.

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: I’m not comfortable with this. Can you give me a number to verify?

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Of course, call 1800-555-1234, but do it after securing your account. Every minute counts!

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: I think I’ll visit the branch instead. I don’t trust online links.

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Madam, branch will take time, and your money is at risk right now. Please, just follow my instructions!

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: I’m sorry, but I’m hanging up to check with the bank myself.

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: You’re making a big mistake, madam! Your account will be frozen!

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: Hey, Shreya, how’s it going?

transcript.speaker: person 2
transcript.message: Hey, Vikram, all good yaar! Just chilling with some chai. What about you?

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: Same here, just winding down after work. Listen, you watching the IPL match tonight?

transcript.speaker: person 2
transcript.message: Of course, man! Mumbai Indians vs. Chennai Super Kings, right? I’m all set with snacks!

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: Haha, nice! I’m rooting for MI, as always. Got my jersey on already.

transcript.speaker: person 2
transcript.message: Oh, come on! CSK’s gonna crush it. Dhoni’s in killer form this season.

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: We’ll see about that! Wanna bet a plate of vada pav on it?

transcript.speaker: person 2
transcript.message: Deal! Loser buys at that stall near Marine Drive. Game on!

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: You’re so done! Anyway, you coming over for Diwali next week?

transcript.speaker: person 2
transcript.message: Wouldn’t miss it! Your mom’s gulab jamun is the best. I’ll bring some lights for the decor.

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: Perfect! Let’s make it a big one this year. Alright, I’ll call you during the match.

transcript.speaker: person 2
transcript.message: Cool, let’s trash-talk live! Catch you later, Vikram.

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: Haha, for sure. Bye, Shreya!

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: Hey, bro, what’s up? Long time no talk!

transcript.speaker: person 2
transcript.message: Arre, man, just chilling! How’ve you been, yaar?

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: All good, just busy with work. Thinking of planning something for Diwali weekend. You free?

transcript.speaker: person 2
transcript.message: Diwali? Dude, I’m always free for festivities! What’s the plan?

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: Was thinking we hit up a beach in Goa. Small getaway, you know?

transcript.speaker: person 2
transcript.message: Goa, nice! Count me in. When are we leaving?

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: Probably Friday night. Take a bus or train from Mumbai.

transcript.speaker: person 2
transcript.message: Sounds good. Let’s book soon, tickets sell out fast during Diwali.

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: True that. I’ll check for bus tickets tonight. You got any hotel recs?

transcript.speaker: person 2
transcript.message: Yeah, I know a decent shack near Baga. I’ll send you the details.

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: Perfect. Also, we gotta try some local fish curry there, man.

transcript.speaker: person 2
transcript.message: 100%! And some feni to wash it down, haha.

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: Haha, for sure. Alright, I’ll confirm the tickets and buzz you.

transcript.speaker: person 2
transcript.message: Cool, can’t wait for this break, bro!

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: Same here. Talk soon!

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: Hey bro, kya haal hai? Long time no chat!

transcript.speaker: person 2
transcript.message: Arre, bhai! All good here. Tu bata, sab theek?

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: Haan, sab mast. Just thought of catching up. Diwali ke plans kya hai tere?

transcript.speaker: person 2
transcript.message: Abhi toh kuch fixed nahi, bas ghar pe family ke saath. Maybe some phuljhadi and mithai. Tu?

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: Mera bhi same, but thinking of a small get-together. Aa ja na, maza aayega.

transcript.speaker: person 2
transcript.message: Sounds good! Kab hai yeh plan?

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: Diwali ke ek din pehle. Evening mein, mere ghar pe. Chai aur samosa on me!

transcript.speaker: person 2
transcript.message: Arre, samosa sunte hi mooh mein pani aa gaya. I’m in!

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: Haha, perfect. Aur bata, kaam kaise chal raha hai?

transcript.speaker: person 2
transcript.message: Bas, thoda hectic hai. Tu bol, Mumbai ka traffic survive kar raha hai?

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: Kya bole, bhai. Har din ek jung hai yahan. But manage ho jaata hai.

transcript.speaker: person 2
transcript.message: Haha, true. Chalo, Diwali pe milte hai. Details bhej dena.

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: Pakka. Take care, bhai.

transcript.speaker: person 2
transcript.message: Tu bhi, bye!

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: Hey bhai, how are you doing?

transcript.speaker: person 2
transcript.message: Arre di, I’m good! Just had some chai with friends. What about you?

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: All good here. Just winding down after work. Are you coming to Delhi for Rakhi this year?

transcript.speaker: person 2
transcript.message: Planning to, yaar. Got my leave approved. When are you tying the rakhi?

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: Great! Let’s do it on the day itself. I’ve got a nice gift for you.

transcript.speaker: person 2
transcript.message: Arey, no need for gifts, di. Just your blessings are enough.

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: Haha, you can’t escape the gift! Anyway, how’s Mumbai treating you?

transcript.speaker: person 2
transcript.message: It’s the usual chaos, but I love it. Vada pav for lunch almost every day!

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: Haha, you and your street food obsession. Just don’t overdo it, okay?

transcript.speaker: person 2
transcript.message: Don’t worry, I’m fine. Hey, did you talk to Mummy about the Rakhi plans?

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: Not yet, I’ll call her after this. She’ll be thrilled you’re coming.

transcript.speaker: person 2
transcript.message: Cool, let me know if she’s making her famous kheer. I’m already drooling!

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: Haha, I’ll ask. Alright, I’ll catch up with you later, bhai.

transcript.speaker: person 2
transcript.message: Sure, di. Take care and see you soon!

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Namaste, madam! I’m calling from India Lucky Lottery. Congratulations, you’ve won ₹10 lakh in our Diwali Special Draw!

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: Namaste. But I never participated in any lottery. How did this happen?

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Madam, your mobile number was selected randomly through our system. It’s a gift for Diwali! You just need to verify your identity.

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: Verify? What do I need to do?

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: It’s simple. Just share your Aadhaar number and pay a small processing fee of ₹5000 to claim the prize.

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: ₹5000? That sounds suspicious. Why should I pay to get a prize?

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Madam, it’s just a formality for tax purposes. You can check everything on our website: http://indialuckydraw.co.in. Hurry, the offer expires in 24 hours!

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: I don’t trust websites like this. Can you send me some official proof or letter?

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Madam, there’s no time for paperwork! If you don’t act now, someone else will claim your prize. Think of your family this Diwali!

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: I understand, but I’m not comfortable sharing personal details. I’ll check with someone first.

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Madam, don’t miss this golden chance! Call me back on 98765-43210 if you change your mind. But time is running out!

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: I’ll think about it, but I’m not promising anything. Goodbye.

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Please don’t delay, madam. This is a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity!

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: Okay, I’ve heard enough. Bye.

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: Hey, guess what? I’m planning a trip to Jaipur next month!

transcript.speaker: person 2
transcript.message: Whoa, that’s awesome! Jaipur’s so vibrant. When are you going?

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: Around mid-November, just after Diwali. Thought it’d be a nice getaway.

transcript.speaker: person 2
transcript.message: Perfect timing! The weather’s great then. You going with family or friends?

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: Just me and my cousin, Neha. We’re super excited to explore the forts.

transcript.speaker: person 2
transcript.message: Hawa Mahal and Amber Fort are musts. Have you booked anything yet?

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: Not yet, just looking at train tickets on IRCTC. Any hotel recos?

transcript.speaker: person 2
transcript.message: Hmm, check out some heritage stays near the Pink City. They’re a bit pricey but worth it.

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: Good idea! I’ll search for some on MakeMyTrip. What about food there?

transcript.speaker: person 2
transcript.message: Oh, you’ve gotta try dal baati churma. It’s a Rajasthani classic!

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: Noted! I’m already dreaming of it with some hot chai.

transcript.speaker: person 2
transcript.message: Haha, nothing beats that combo. Let me know if you need help with bookings.

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: Thanks, will do. I’ll send you pics when I’m there!

transcript.speaker: person 2
transcript.message: Can’t wait to see them. Safe travels, yaar!

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: Hey, Neha! Just wanted to update you on the project we’re handling.

transcript.speaker: person 2
transcript.message: Hey, Priya! Good to hear from you. How’s it going?

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: It’s going pretty smoothly. I finally finished the presentation for the Delhi client.

transcript.speaker: person 2
transcript.message: That’s awesome! Did they like the initial draft?

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: Yeah, they did! They had a few tweaks, but nothing major. I’m sending it for final approval today.

transcript.speaker: person 2
transcript.message: Nice! You’re killing it. Btw, are you free for a quick chai break later?

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: Oh, I’d love that! Let’s meet at the usual stall near Andheri station around 4?

transcript.speaker: person 2
transcript.message: Perfect! I’ve been craving some cutting chai all day.

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: Haha, same! Also, just a heads-up, I might need your input on the next phase next week.

transcript.speaker: person 2
transcript.message: No worries, I’ve got your back. Let’s discuss over chai today.

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: Thanks, yaar. You’re the best. See you at 4!

transcript.speaker: person 2
transcript.message: See you, Priya. Take care till then!

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Hello, madam, good afternoon! I’m Priya from SBI customer care. There’s an urgent issue with your bank account.

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: Good afternoon. What issue? I haven’t noticed anything wrong.

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Madam, someone tried to withdraw ₹50,000 from your account just now. We’ve blocked it temporarily, but you need to secure it immediately.

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: Oh my God, that’s scary! How do I secure it?

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Don’t worry, I’ll help you. Just visit our secure portal at http://secure.sbi-verify.com and update your details. It’s urgent!

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: Wait, why can’t I do this at the bank branch? I’m not sure about online links.

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Madam, branches are slow, and this is a critical situation. If you don’t act now, your money could be at risk before Diwali celebrations!

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: Hmm, I don’t know… Can you send me an official SMS or email instead?

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: We can’t send SMS due to system updates, madam. Trust me, this link is 100% safe. Just click and verify your Aadhaar and PIN.

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: I’m not comfortable sharing my PIN online. This feels suspicious.

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Madam, I’m trying to save your account! If you don’t do this, we can’t stop the fraud. Please, it’s for your safety.

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: I’ll visit the bank tomorrow and sort this out. I’m not clicking any links.

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Madam, tomorrow might be too late! Your account could be empty by then!

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: I’m sorry, but I’ll handle this directly with SBI. Please don’t call again.

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Madam, you’re making a big mistake! Think about your family!

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: I’m hanging up now. Goodbye.

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Hello Sir, this is Priya from SBI Customer Care. I’m calling about an urgent issue with your account.

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: Hello, Priya. What’s the problem with my account?

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Sir, we’ve detected a fraudulent transaction of ₹75,000 from your account just an hour ago. We need to secure it immediately.

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: What? I didn’t make any such transaction. How did this happen?

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: It seems someone has accessed your details, maybe through a phishing link. Please confirm your identity by sharing your Aadhaar number.

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: I don’t think I should share my Aadhaar number over the phone. Isn’t that unsafe?

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Sir, this is a secure line. If you don’t act now, you might lose more money, especially during this Diwali season when frauds are high.

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: Hmm, I’m still not sure. Can I visit the branch to sort this out?

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Sir, the branch will take time, and the money could be gone by then. Just visit our secure portal at http://sbi-accountverify.com and update your details.

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: That website doesn’t sound right. Why isn’t it the official SBI site?

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Sir, this is a temporary emergency portal for fraud cases. Please trust me, I’m trying to save your money!

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: I don’t know, Priya. I think I’ll call SBI directly on their official number.

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Sir, don’t waste time! Call this number 1800-123-4567 for verification if you’re unsure, but hurry!

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: I’m not comfortable with this. I’m hanging up and reporting this call.

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Sir, please don’t do this! Your money is at risk! Just follow the link!

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: No, I’m done here. Goodbye.

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: Hey, Priya! Just got a call from the Amazon delivery guy. My parcel is out for delivery today!

transcript.speaker: person 2
transcript.message: Oh, nice, Rohan! What did you order? Something exciting?

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: Yeah, it’s a Bluetooth speaker. Been wanting one for ages to play music during Diwali parties.

transcript.speaker: person 2
transcript.message: That’s awesome! Which brand? I could use one for my house too.

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: It’s a JBL. Got it on a good discount during the sale.

transcript.speaker: person 2
transcript.message: Nice catch! Are you gonna test it out as soon as it arrives?

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: Of course! Wanna come over? We can play some old Bollywood tracks and have chai.

transcript.speaker: person 2
transcript.message: Haha, sounds like a plan! I’m in. What time should I drop by?

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: Let’s say around 5 PM? I’ll text you once the delivery guy hands it over.

transcript.speaker: person 2
transcript.message: Perfect! I’ll bring some samosas from that shop near my place in Mumbai.

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: Deal! Can’t wait to munch on those. See you soon!

transcript.speaker: person 2
transcript.message: See you, Rohan! Bye for now.

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Hello, sir, this is Priya from Tech Support for Windows. I’m calling because we’ve detected a critical virus on your computer.

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: Hello, Priya. A virus? My computer seems to be working fine. How do you know this?

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Sir, we have remote monitoring tools at Microsoft India. Your system is sending error reports to us. It’s very urgent.

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: Hmm, I’ve never heard of this. What do I need to do?

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Sir, you need to act immediately before your data gets stolen. Please visit http://windows-secure.in and download our security tool.

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: Wait, that URL doesn’t sound right. Why isn’t it a Microsoft website?

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Sir, this is a secure portal for Indian users. If you don’t do this now, hackers can access your bank details, even your SBI account!

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: My SBI account? That’s serious. But I’m not sure I trust this. How did you get my number?

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Sir, we have your details from the Windows registration. Please, this is not a joke. Think about your family’s safety—your Aadhaar data could be compromised!

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: Aadhaar? Now you’re scaring me. But I’ll check with my bank first before doing anything.

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Sir, there’s no time! Call our helpline at 1800-987-6543 right now to secure your system. Don’t risk everything!

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: I don’t know, Priya. This feels off. I’m not calling any number until I verify this.

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Sir, please don’t hang up! If you ignore this, you could lose all your savings. Act now!

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: I’m sorry, but I’m going to disconnect. I’ll look into this myself. Goodbye.

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Sir, wait! This is very urgent! Don’t regret this later!

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Namaste, madam, this is Rohan from SBI Customer Care. There’s an urgent issue with your bank account.

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: Namaste, Rohan. What’s wrong with my account?

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Madam, we’ve detected unauthorized transactions on your account. Rs. 50,000 has been debited just now.

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: What? I didn’t make any transaction! How is this possible?

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Don’t worry, madam, but we need to act fast. Please verify your identity on our secure portal at http://secure.sbi-verify.com.

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: Hmm, I’ve never heard of verifying through a website. Can’t we do this over the phone?

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Madam, due to security protocols, we can only process this online. It’s urgent, or your entire balance could be at risk.

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: This sounds a bit suspicious. Why would SBI send me to a website I’ve never seen before?

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Madam, this is a temporary link for emergency cases only. If you don’t act now, we won’t be able to help you recover the money.

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: I’m not sure about this. Can you give me a number to call back and confirm?

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Of course, madam, note down 1800-555-1234. But please, don’t delay. Every minute counts!

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: Okay, I’ll call this number and check. But I’m not clicking any link until I’m sure.

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Madam, please don’t take this lightly. Think about your family’s savings. Just visit the link quickly!

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: I’m sorry, but I’ll verify first. Goodbye.

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Madam, wait! You’re making a big mistake!

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: I’ll decide that after checking. Bye.

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Hello, this is Priya from CapitalSecure Investments. Congratulations, sir, you’ve been selected for a special Diwali investment scheme with guaranteed 200% returns!

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: Hello, Priya. 200% returns sound too good to be true. Can you explain how this works?

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Of course, sir! We invest in high-growth stocks tied to festive season trends. Just invest ₹50,000 today, and you’ll see ₹1.5 lakh by next month!

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: Hmm, that’s a big promise. Are you registered with SEBI or RBI?

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Absolutely, sir! We’re fully certified. You can check all details on our secure portal at http://capitalsecure-deal.com. Sign up now!

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: I’d like to verify this first. Can you send me your registration certificate or some proof?

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Sir, there’s no time for that! This Diwali offer closes in 24 hours. If you miss it, you’ll regret it!

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: I’m not comfortable rushing into this. I need proper documentation.

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Sir, think about your family! This money could help with big Diwali expenses. Just share your Aadhaar details for quick registration.

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: I’m not sharing personal details over the phone. This sounds suspicious.

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Sir, don’t miss this golden chance! Call me back on 1800-555-1234 if you change your mind. Hurry!

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: I don’t think so. Please don’t call me again. Goodbye.

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Namaste ji, this is Rohit from SBI Loan Services. We have a pre-approved loan of ₹5 lakh for you!

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: Namaste, but I never applied for any loan with SBI. How did you get my number?

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Sir, your name came up in our database as a valued customer. Just verify your details at http://sbi-loansecure.com to claim this urgent offer!

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: That sounds strange. I don’t remember sharing my details for any loan. Can you tell me more?

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Of course, sir! It’s a special Diwali offer, low interest, only for selected customers. But you must act fast, offer ends in 24 hours!

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: Hmm, I’m not sure. What details do you need? I don’t want to share anything sensitive.

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Just your Aadhaar number and bank account details for quick processing. It’s 100% safe on our secure portal!

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: Aadhaar number? That doesn’t sound right. I think this might be a scam.

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Sir, no scam! I’m calling from SBI head office. You can trust us. Call our helpline 1800-555-1234 to confirm!

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: I’ll check with my bank directly. I’m not sharing anything over the phone.

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Sir, don’t miss this chance! Your family could use this money for Diwali celebrations!

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: I appreciate the concern, but I’m not interested. Please don’t call again.

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Just one minute, sir! Think about it, ₹5 lakh instantly!

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: No, thank you. Goodbye.

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: Hey Riya, how’s it going? Been a while!

transcript.speaker: person 2
transcript.message: Hey Vikram, I’m good! Just busy with Diwali prep. How are you?

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: Doing great, just wanted to ask about that new internet provider you switched to in Pune.

transcript.speaker: person 2
transcript.message: Oh, yeah! I got AirNet last month. It’s been pretty smooth so far.

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: Really? I’m fed up with my current one. How’s the speed?

transcript.speaker: person 2
transcript.message: Quite fast, honestly. I’m getting around 100 Mbps for streaming and work.

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: That’s impressive. What about customer support? Any issues?

transcript.speaker: person 2
transcript.message: They’re decent. Had a small glitch once, but they fixed it in a day.

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: Good to hear. How much are you paying monthly?

transcript.speaker: person 2
transcript.message: Around ₹900 with taxes. They had a Diwali discount when I signed up.

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: Not bad! I’ll check their website. Thanks for the info, Riya.

transcript.speaker: person 2
transcript.message: No worries, Vikram. Let me know if you need the referral code for extra discount.

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: Oh, that’d be awesome. Send it over on WhatsApp?

transcript.speaker: person 2
transcript.message: Sure, I’ll do it right after this call. By the way, you coming to Mumbai for Diwali?

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: Planning to. Let’s catch up over some chai if I’m there!

transcript.speaker: person 2
transcript.message: Definitely! Looking forward to it. Talk soon!

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: Take care, bye!

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: Hey, Riya, how’s it going?

transcript.speaker: person 2
transcript.message: Hey, Vikram! All good, just winding down after a long day. You?

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: Same here. Just finished helping my cousin with his Class 10 board prep. Man, those NCERT books are no joke!

transcript.speaker: person 2
transcript.message: Haha, tell me about it! I remember those days. Maths was a nightmare. How’s he doing though?

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: He’s okay, just stressed about Science. I told him to chill, boards aren’t the end of the world.

transcript.speaker: person 2
transcript.message: True that. Hey, are you guys doing anything for Diwali? Maybe we can plan something together?

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: Yeah, we’re hosting a small get-together at home in Pune. You should come! Mom’s making her famous gulab jamuns.

transcript.speaker: person 2
transcript.message: Oh, I’m sold already! Count me in. I’ll bring some sparklers for the kids.

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: Perfect! It’ll be nice to catch up properly. Been ages since we met.

transcript.speaker: person 2
transcript.message: Totally. I’ll check my schedule and confirm the dates. Can’t wait!

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: Cool, let me know. Also, bring your appetite—there’s gonna be a lot of food!

transcript.speaker: person 2
transcript.message: Haha, don’t worry, I’m always ready for that! Talk soon, Vikram.

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: Yeah, take care, Riya!

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Hello, sir! Congratulations! You’ve been shortlisted for a manager position at Reliance Industries. I’m calling from HR.

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: Hello, that sounds great, but I don’t remember applying for Reliance. How did this happen?

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Sir, we found your profile on Naukri.com. This is a golden opportunity, especially before Diwali! We just need a small registration fee of ₹5000 to process your joining.

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: Registration fee? I’ve never heard of Reliance asking for money upfront. Can you confirm this?

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Absolutely, sir! This is for training and verification. Please visit http://reliance-careers.co.in to complete the payment. It’s urgent, offer closes today!

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: Hmm, that website doesn’t look official. Shouldn’t it be reliance.com or something?

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Sir, this is our secure portal for new hires. Don’t miss this chance! Jobs like these don’t come every day.

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: I’m not comfortable paying without an offer letter. Can you email me the details first?

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Sir, the letter will be released only after payment. It’s company policy. Please trust us, think of your family this festive season!

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: I’m sorry, but this feels suspicious. I’ll check with Reliance directly. Please don’t call again.

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Sir, you’re making a big mistake! This is a limited-time offer. Pay now or lose it forever!

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: I’m not paying anything. Goodbye.

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: Hey, Priya, kya chal raha hai?

transcript.speaker: person 2
transcript.message: Arre, Rohit, bas ghar pe hoon. Just finished some Diwali cleaning. You?

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: Nice! Main toh bas office se aaya. By the way, did you see the new Bollywood movie trailer?

transcript.speaker: person 2
transcript.message: Haan, that one with Ranveer Singh, right? Looks so masala!

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: Exactly! I’m thinking we should catch it this weekend. Kya bolti hai?

transcript.speaker: person 2
transcript.message: Sounds good! But only if we grab some vada pav after. I’m craving it.

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: Deal! Mumbai ki streets pe best vada pav hi milta hai.

transcript.speaker: person 2
transcript.message: Haha, true that. Let’s book tickets online na, before they’re sold out.

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: Good idea. I’ll check the timings on BookMyShow. Evening show okay?

transcript.speaker: person 2
transcript.message: Perfect. And hey, bring your brother along if he’s free.

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: Arre, woh toh busy hai. But I’ll ask. Chal, I’ll call you once tickets are booked.

transcript.speaker: person 2
transcript.message: Cool. Can’t wait for the movie and snacks!

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: Haha, same here. Talk soon, Priya.

transcript.speaker: person 2
transcript.message: Bye, Rohit!
